qas.question: What did samurai wives spend most of their time on?

answers.text: one who remains in the home

qas.question: What did samurai wives' duties include when their husbands were away?

answers.text: manage all household affairs, care for the children, and perhaps even defend the home forcibly

context: <a0_0>Maintaining the household<a0_0/> was the main duty of samurai women. This was especially crucial during early feudal Japan, when warrior husbands were often traveling abroad or engaged in clan battles. The wife, or okugatasama (meaning: <a1_0>one who remains in the home<a1_0/>), was left to <a2_0>manage all household affairs, care for the children, and perhaps even defend the home forcibly<a2_0/>. For this reason, many women of the samurai class were trained in wielding <a3_0>a polearm<a3_0/> called a naginata or a special knife called the kaiken in an art called tantojutsu (lit. <a4_0>the skill of the knife<a4_0/>), which they could use to protect their household, family, and honor if the need arose.
